benchmark_details.name: Express4D (Expressive, Friendly, and Extensible 4D Facial Motion Generation Benchmark)
benchmark_details.overview: Express4D is a facial motion dataset and baseline benchmark, comprising 1205 diverse sequences performed by 18 participants, featuring LLM-based natural language instruction labels which are performed and recorded.

purpose_and_intended_users.goal: To enable automatic facial motion generation from natural language.
purpose_and_intended_users.limitations: The expressions are based on non-professional actors, potentially missing some complex expressions.

data.source: Collected using ARKit framework via the Live Link Face app

methodology.calculation: Metrics computed by comparing generated sequences with real sequences via learned feature embeddings.
methodology.interpretation: Lower scores indicate better model performance in generating realistic and diverse motion sequences.
methodology.validation: Evaluated using initial performances of two baseline models trained on the dataset.

targeted_risks.demographic_analysis: The dataset covers emotions from diverse participants but may not fully represent ethnic diversity.

ethical_and_legal_considerations.data_licensing: Released under a license prohibiting malicious applications including deep-fake generation.
ethical_and_legal_considerations.consent_procedures: Participants provided consent for their expressions to be recorded.
